page.title: 11BY=PASS ROAD LEADENHAM
page.content: A by-pass for Leadenham was first proposed in the 1930's.Since then several schemes have been put forward, all of which have failed to materialise, usually for economic reasons. In 1973 a route was adopted and by 1976 compulsory purchase orders had been published.This scheme was also abandoned for economic reasons.In 1984 the Dept.of Transport proposed a Relief Road Scheme which cut the village in half.A petition signed by 90% of the familiesliving in Leadenham has been sent to the Government pressing for a full by-pass and an early completion.In summer 1985 the Dept.of Transport approved a full by-pass originally planned in 1973 with work scheduled to start in 1987 or later. The Parish Council is currently pressing for a speedier completion of the project.
